knimeNode.name: Diagnose Runtime
knimeNode.shortDescription: Collects all runtime information about the JVM.

intro.p: This node reports different information that could be relevant for debugging.

There are four output tables: system properties, environment variables, information about VM threads and options set to the JVM. Additionally, the node dialog provides to option to dump out the heap information to a specified file. In detail, this node provides:
System Properties: All system properties used to configure the current working environment.
Environment Variables: All global variables that the OS uses for configuration.
Threads Information: Information about JVM Threads, including following properties: The thread's name, status, CPU time, user time, whether a deadlock was detected, whether the thread holds itself any locks, threads that currently block it and the call stacks per thread.
VM Options: All options set to the JVM.

fullDescription.option: Enables or disables whether the heap dump should be to a file on the disk.
File chooser to select the location of the heap dump file. This file will always have an ".hprof" file extension.

ports.outPort: The collected information about threads, including StackTraces.
All options set to the JVM.
